sen.j: 園基音（その もとなり、慶長9年8月23日 (旧暦)（1604年9月16日） - 承応4年2月17日 (旧暦)（1655年3月24日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Motonari SONO (September 16, 1604 - March 24, 1655) was a kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.

sen.j: 霊元天皇の外祖父にあたる人物。
sen.e: He was a maternal grandfather of Emperor Reigen.

sen.j: 主に後陽成天皇（107代）から後光明天皇（110代）にわたる四帝に仕えた廷臣で、官位は正二位権大納言（薨去後左大臣追贈）まで昇る。
sen.e: He mainly served four emperors as a retainer of the Imperical Court from Emperor Goyozei (107th) to Emperor Gokomyo (110th) and was promoted to Shonii Gon Dainagon (chief councillor of state in the Senior Second Rank); the court rank he was conferred post-humously after his death was sadaijin (Minister of the left).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served four emperors and an empress, mainly from the time of Emperor Goyozei (107th) to Emperor Gokomyo (110th) and was promoted to Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Chief Councilor of State); the court rank he was conferred posthumously was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).

sen.j: その後も踏歌節会外弁・権中納言を経て、慶安元年（1648年）に権大納言となる。
sen.e: Subsequently, he became Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside the Imperial Court Ceremony, called Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie) and Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) and in 1648, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor).

He became Toka no sechie (Circle-Dancing Banquet: the last of the First Month's three great banquets [sechie] which formerly took place from the fourteenth to the sixteenth of January in the Shishinden [the Throne Hall] of the Imperial Court under the moonlight) Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the Imperial Court Ceremony outside of Jomei Gate) and Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-councilor of State), and was promoted to Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State) in 1648.

sen.j: もともと園家は権中納言が極官だったが、基任・基音と二代にわたって天皇の外祖父を出したことにより、園家の宮中での席次も上がり、基音の子である基福は異例の准大臣に叙せられた。
sen.e: Originally, the highest position of the Sono family was Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor); however, as the family's two generations, Mototo and Motonari were maternal grandfathers, the family's class standing was raised accordingly, and Motoyoshi, Motonari's son was appointed as Jun-daijin, which was an unsual case.

Originally, Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-councilor of State) was Kyokkan (the most highest rank which the family members were appointed) of the Sono family, but their position in the Imperial Court was raised as Mototo and Motonari, for two consecutive generations, became the maternal grandfathers of the emperors, and Motoyoshi, a son of Motonari, was unprecedentedly appointed to Jun-daijin.

sen.e: Originally, Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-councilor of State) was Kyokkan (the most highest rank which the family members were appointed) of the Sono family, but their position in the Imperial Court was raised as Mototo and Motonari, for two consecutive generations, became the maternal grandfathers of the emperors, and Motoyoshi, a son of Motonari, was unprecedentedly appointed to Jun-daijin.

sen.j: またそれ以降の当主もほとんどが権大納言まで昇り、園家は事実上権大納言を極官とする家へ昇格するのであった。
sen.e: Even after that, most of their family heads were promoted to Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor); the family rose to a higher class that the highest rank they received became Gon Dainagon.
After Motoyoshi's appointment, most of the heads of the Sono family were promoted to Gon Dainagon, which raised the family rank and practically made Gon Dainagon Kyokkan of the family.
